snippet.title: Search for US marines off Qld
snippet.content: A US Marine Corps MV-22 helicopter's crew members are reported missing off central Queensland. A military statement says there was an accident on Saturday afternoon. The US Marine Corps Public Affairs Office said tonight it "confirms there is an active search and rescue mission ongoing for service members involved in an MV-22 mishap off the east coast of Australia". "Ships, small boats and aircraft from the 31st Marine Expeditionary Unit and Bonhomme Richard expeditionary strike group are conducting the search and rescue operations,'' it said. The helicopter was in Queensland for the Talisman Sabre multi-nation defence exercises near Rockhampton.

sindex.name: US Marine Corps Public Affairs Office
